ngiemboon: Peg ee páʼɔɔn é ŋweʼe ŋwàʼne, é lɔg sele túm twó mbùm ség keen? Kà peg ge nyɛ pɔ́ ŋwàʼne gie mé lɔ̌g ńtúmo wég páʼ tsɔ́ pʉ̀a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi gÿo, kà pi zɔ ge náa?
en: Are we beginning to commend ourselves again? Or do we need, like some, letters of recommendation to you or from you?

ngiemboon: Pi pɛ̂ zɔɔ yég ŋwàʼne, mbà mé la ŋweʼe tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m wég, epʉ̀a metsèm ne ńzsé ḿbiŋ ne ńtóŋo,
en: You yourselves are our letter, written on our hearts, known and read by everyone.

ngiemboon: ngwɔ́ mé lɔg pɔ́ nÿɔ́g ńgyá ngie pi ee ŋwàʼne gie Keleto la ŋweʼe, ńtúmo wég, peg tó ńná. À la te lɔg pɔ́ nkwoŋ ŋwàʼne tá ńŋweʼe yɛ̌ ŋwàʼne wɔ́, à la gwaa ŋweʼe, ńcʉa pɔ́ na Zẅìge Ssé, yé Ssé gẅie aa wó, ńgwɔ́ ntʉ̀ntʉ̀. À la te ŋweʼe na púɔ melàŋa tóon wɔ́, à la ŋweʼe pɔ́ na ntʉ́m pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: You show that you are Christ’s letter,   delivered  # 3:3 Lit ministered to by us, not written with ink but with the Spirit of the living God  # 3:3 Dt 5:26  #— #not on tablets of stone  # 3:3 Ex 24:12 but on tablets of human hearts.  # 3:3 Lit fleshly hearts,# 3:3 Pr 3:3; 7:3; Jr 17:1; 31:33; Ezk 11:19; 36:26; Heb 8:10

ngiemboon: Peg gɔɔn nò na faʼa yég páʼɔɔn, á nue peg lɔg páʼ peg la nnɛ́ na Keleto, ńkwaʼ ńzsé ngie Ssé zẅíŋe nò yég.
en: Such is the confidence we have through Christ before God.

ngiemboon: Peg ké těen ńgɔɔn páʼɔɔn ngie ngwɔ́ peg lɔg kwàʼ még metʉ̀ ńgÿo tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́. Metʉ̀ mie peg lɔgɔ faʼa yɔɔn fàʼ, é fóo pɔ́ mbwó Ssé.
en: It is not that we are competent in   ourselves to claim anything as coming from ourselves, but our adequacy is from God.  # 3:5 1Co 15:10

ngiemboon: Yé zɔ ka gÿo peg kuʼu légwɔ́ pafaʼa fàʼ, á na kʉ̀a yesẅé. Ayɛ̌ kʉ̀a á téen fóo pɔ́ na lepʉ̌ sie mé la ŋweʼe wɔ́, á fóo pɔ́ na Zẅìge Ssé. Lepʉ̌ sie mé la ŋweʼe, é gÿo nyìŋ kwé kwě, Azẅìge gÿo nyìŋ gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó.
en: He has made us competent to be ministers of a new covenant,   not of the letter,  # 3:6 Rm 7:6 but of the Spirit. For the letter kills, but the Spirit gives life.

ngiemboon: Pi gíŋ ńne ńzsé gí páʼ nò lepʉ̌ laa púʼu. Mé la ŋweʼe na melàŋa tóon, é gÿo mé kwé kwě. Táʼ, mbɔɔ púʼu, afàʼ na nò lepʉ̌ ŋwɛ́, á gẅiin máamáa shʉ́shÿɔ́g, tà pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ té fʉʼʉ lélíe wɛ̌ shʉ́shÿɔ́g na shÿó Mǒonsê wɔ́, mbɔɔ páʼ à lɔ̌ɔn těen ńnéŋe wɔ́.
en: Now if the ministry that brought death, chiseled in letters on stones, came with glory,   so that the Israelites were not able to gaze steadily at Moses’s face because of its glory, which was set aside,

ngiemboon: Páʼ á laa púʼu la, á ge gǎa tá fàʼ na nò Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a, á le náa shʉ́shÿɔ́g tà ńtɔ́gɔ wɛ̌ wɔ́ɔ?
en: how will the ministry of the Spirit not be more glorious?

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie nò na fàʼa lepʉ̌ la gẅiin shʉ́shÿɔ́g, mbà anò na fàʼ gie á gÿo epʉ̀a tyé ndʉŋndʉŋ mvfò Ssé, á ge ké gẅiin shʉ́shÿɔ́g é cʉa yɛ̌.
en: For if the ministry that brought condemnation had glory, the ministry that brings righteousness overflows with even more glory.

ngiemboon: Ngwɔ́ pege zɔɔn éfó ńgɔɔn ngie, shʉ́shÿɔ́g we fʉ̀ʼɔɔn pǔ ńgwɔ́ wó tɛʼ, tà we fʉ̀ʼʉmvfò la te tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́.
en: In fact, what had been glorious is not glorious now by comparison because of the glory that surpasses it.

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie ammó gie á lɔ́ɔn te láʼa zɔ́gɔ é gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó wɔ́, á la gẅiin we shʉ́shÿɔ́g, mbà mmó gie á ge láʼa zɔ́gɔ gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó, ge ké gẅiin shʉ́shÿɔ́g é cʉa yɛ̌ cʉa.
en: For if what was set aside   was glorious, what endures will be even more glorious.

ngiemboon: Páʼ peg kwaʼ ne ńzẅíʼte yɔɔn mmó la, peg te ne ńgwaa gɔɔn nò mmó ḿmʉ́ʼte wɔ́.
en: Since, then, we have such a hope,   we act with great boldness.

ngiemboon: Peg te ne ńgÿo páʼ Mǒonsê gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn shuu nkùɔ na shÿó wé, ńdɔgɔ ḿbɔ́gɔ shʉ́shÿɔ́g gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn těen ńge néŋe wɔ́, légwɔ́ gie à ge gwaa mag, epʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ le ne ńgyá wɔ́.
en: We are not like Moses, who used to put a veil over his face   to prevent the Israelites from gazing steadily until the end  # 3:13 Or at the outcome of the glory of what was being set aside,

ngiemboon: Táʼ, á la zɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́, mbà legye sɔ́b leen ńjÿɔ́ʼɔ, é léen ńjÿɔ́ʼɔ jÿɔ́ʼɔ tà ńkú lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn, á nue pɔ́ gwaa tóŋo ŋwàʼne Nzẅìŋe Kʉ̀a, nkùɔ ayɛ̌ nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wó. E nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wó, mélàʼmie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńnyé té la nnɛ́ na Keleto, yɛ̌ nkùɔ nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wó.
en: but their minds were hardened.   For to this day, at the reading of the old covenant,  # 3:14 Ac 13:15; 15:21; Heb 7:22 the same veil remains; it is not lifted, because it is set aside only in Christ.  # 3:14 Rm 16:7; 1Pt 5:14

ngiemboon: Tà ńkú lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn, epʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ gwɔ́ tà ne ńtóŋo meŋwàʼne Mǒonsê, etsɔ̌ nkùɔ pwoon legye sɔ́b.
en: Yet still today, whenever Moses is read, a veil lies over their hearts,

ngiemboon: Tá «nyìŋ kě ńgwɔ́ tà sele nnɛ́ ńdíe Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, nkùɔ zyɛ́bɛ.»
en: but whenever a person turns   to the Lord, the veil is removed.  # 3:16 Ex 34:34

ngiemboon: Á nue Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gwɔ̌ pɔ́ Zẅìge, ajʉʼ gie Zẅìge Cʉ̀apʉ̀a piŋ ńgwɔ́ wó la, atsɔ́ mmó gie ngwɔ́ á táte nyìŋ, á té gíŋ ńgwɔ́ jʉʼó wɔ́.
en: Now the Lord is the Spirit, and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is freedom.

ngiemboon: Pege metsèm te gíŋ ńgẅiin tsɔ̌ nkùɔ na shÿó wégè wɔ́, shʉ́shÿɔ́g Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ne ńtéme na pege, ḿbiŋe nzèm páʼ kyɛ̀ʼ gie á téme na gyɛ̀shÿó la. Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie à gwɔ̌ pɔ́ Zẅìge, à ne ńgÿo pege kúbe ntí, ńgÿo pege sẅé yé, shʉ́shÿɔ́g gẅie aa na pege, á piŋ ne ńkẅiʼi kẅiʼi.
en: We all, with unveiled faces, are looking as in a mirror at  ,# 3:18 1Co 13:12 the glory of the Lord  # 3:18 Jn 17:24; 2Co 1:20; 4:4–6; 1Tm 1:11,17 and are being transformed  # 3:18 Mk 9:2 into the same image  # 3:18 Gn 1:27; 1Jn 3:2 from glory to glory; this is from the Lord who is the Spirit.  # 3:18 Or from the Spirit of the Lord, or from the Lord, the Spirit
